Problem

How could this data be accessed programatically? 

{
      "title": "Methods for the analysis of large data-sets",
      "author": "Di Ciaccio, Agostino.",
      "year": "2012",
      "library": "Hunter Main",
      "docNumber": "007268706",
}

<TITLE>Greatest Hits</TITLE>

<COMPANY>RCA</COMPANY>
<PRICE>9.90</PRICE>

The DOM Tree

<html>
    <head></head>
<body>
    <h1>Header text here</h1>
    <div>
        <p>Paragraph text here</p>
        <h2>Subheader text here</h2>
    </div>
    <div>
        <p>Another paragraph here</p>
    </div>
</body>
</html>

↓

I looked, first, for JSON data

Behind the Curtain


app.get('/marc', function (req, res){
    var docNumber = req.query["docNumber"];
    var verbose = req.query["verbose"];
    var uriBase = 'http://apps.appl.cuny.edu:83/F/';
    verbose == '1' ? format = '001' : format = '002'

    var options = {
        uri: uriBase + '?func=direct&doc_number=' + docNumber + '&format=' + format
    };
    request(options, function(error, response, body) {
    //  debugger;
        console.log(options.uri);
        if (error && response.statusCode !== 200) {
            console.log(error);
        }

        jsdom.env({
                html: body,
                scripts: [
                    'https://ajax.googleapis.com/ajax/libs/jquery/1.8.2/jquery.min.js'
                ]
            }, function (err, window) {
            // load jquery
            var $ = window.jQuery;
            $('img[src]').each(function(i,el){
                $(el).removeAttr('src');
            });

            var wholeMarc = {};

            var resultsTable = $('table')[4]; //Grabbing the MARC Record

            var rows = $(resultsTable).children('tr');
            rows.each(function (i, item) {
                var marcLabel = $(item).children('td')[0];
                var marcValue = $(item).children('td')[1];
                var name = $(marcLabel).text().trim();
                var value = $(marcValue).text().trim();
                wholeMarc[name] = value;
            });
            res.writeHead(200, {
                'Content-Type': 'text/plain',
                'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' : '*'
            });
            res.end(JSON.stringify(wholeMarc, null, 2));
        });
    });
});

using Nodejs

The API

Currently located at: 

mighty-wildwood-7308.herokuapp.com
To do a search for 'global warming' in Hunter College: 
/search?query=global+warming&queryType=All+Fields&school=HUNTER
Try it out Here

↓

Other Searches

  • /details?docNumber=006466386&library=HCRSV
  • /marc?docNumber=006466386

Small Tutorial

Python

import requests
def lookup_ISBN(ISBN, school):
    payload = {'query' : ISBN, 'queryType' : 'ISBN', 'school' : school}
    r = requests.get('http://mighty-wildwood-7308.herokuapp.com/search', params=payload)
    JSON_record = r.json()
    return JSON_record

Javascript

var req = $.getJSON('http://mighty-wildwood-7308.herokuapp.com/search', 
{'query':query, 'queryType': queryType, 'school': whichLibrary},
function(data) {})
.success(function(data) {
    // Do stuff
})

Useful?

  • API Mashups (Worldcat, DOI.org, Amazon(?))
  • Collection Development/Analysis
  • Customize the Catalog Experience
  • Empower Librarians to Use Their Own Metadata

Possibilities

↓

Collection Development!

Given a list of ISBNs, for each item get:

  1. Title
  2. Price
  3. Holdings at all CUNY Libraries for this and any other edition
  4. Closest non-CUNY Library with the title
  5. Subject Headings
  6. Rating on Amazon
↓

Simplify Inventory!

(Know Thy Shelf)

↓

Create a Whole New Catalog!

  • Responsive

  • Customized for your patrons' needs
